info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 10:56PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Anderson.
.Minor flooding has developed near Muncie along the White River due to recent heavy rain. Flooding is expected to continue into at least early next week due to additional rounds of heavy rainfall. Additional rainfall of two to four inches is possible.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Anderson.
* WHEN...From this evening until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flood waters close Edgewood Park and Grand Avenue between Alexandria Pike and Broadway. If river is rising at this level, the City of Anderson notifies residents along Hazlett Street, near W 1st Street and Madison Avenue, near W 2nd Street and Sycamore Street, and along Riverside Drive to prepare for sandbagging operations and possible evacuations.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM EDT Thursday was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday morning and continue rising to a crest of 13.3 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Friday afternoon by around 200 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
